H0.text: Metallurgy is the set of processes by which metals are extracted from their ores and converted to more useful forms.

H1.text: Metamorphisis means the set of processes by which metals are extracted from their ores and converted to more useful forms.

H2.text: Introversion is the set of processes by which metals are extracted from their ores and converted to more useful forms.

H3.text: Ceramics is the term that means the set of processes by which metals are extracted from their ores and converted to more useful forms.

A4.text: Extractive metallurgy is the practice of removing valuable metals from an ore and refining the extracted raw metals into a purer form.

A5.text: Metallurgy is a domain of materials science and engineering that studies the physical and chemical behavior of metallic elements, their inter-metallic compounds, and their mixtures, which are known as alloys.
